Work Expenses module has partial employee grouping capabilities that could inform access control design

what_to_do.task: Create an Employee Group with Automatic Grouping
steps: Click 'Add New' to create a new employee group
Choose 'Automatic Grouping' as the grouping method
Configure automatic grouping parameters (based on predefined criteria)
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Employee group is created with automatic grouping rules applied. Employees matching the predefined parameters are automatically assigned to the group.
rules_and_constraints: Automatic grouping uses predefined parameters to assign employees
Group name and description are required fields
Only HR Admin or Super Admin can create employee groups
edge_cases: Ensure grouping parameters are configured correctly to avoid incorrect employee assignments
Verify that automatic grouping rules do not create overlapping group memberships

what_to_do.task: Create an Employee Group with Manual Selection
steps: Click 'Add New' to create a new employee group
Choose 'Manual Grouping' as the grouping method
Manually select specific employees to add to the group
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Employee group is created with manually selected employees. Only the specified employees are members of this group.
rules_and_constraints: Manual grouping requires explicit selection of individual employees
Group name and description are required fields
Only HR Admin or Super Admin can create employee groups
Employees can be added or removed from manually-created groups at any time
edge_cases: Ensure all intended employees are selected during group creation
Verify employee list is accurate before saving to avoid manual corrections later

what_to_do.task: Assign Employee Group Viewership Permissions to Admin Roles
steps: Select the admin role that requires employee group permissions
Assign specific employee groups to the selected role
Configure viewership permissions (which employee groups this role can view)
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Admin role has restricted access to payroll and employee data only for assigned employee groups. Admins can only view information for employees in their assigned groups.
rules_and_constraints: Admins can only view payroll data for assigned employee groups
Different admin roles can have different permission levels and group assignments
Viewership permissions are enforced across all modules that display employee or payroll data
Data confidentiality is maintained by limiting access based on group assignment
edge_cases: Ensure data confidentiality by carefully limiting payroll data access to appropriate admin roles
Verify that only relevant admins can view specific employee group information
Monitor for permission conflicts if an admin is assigned to overlapping groups

what_to_do.task: Use Employee Structures for Automatic Leave Policy Assignment
steps: Go to Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies
Create or edit a leave policy
Select an employee structure (previously created group) for automatic assignment
Confirm that employees in the selected structure are automatically assigned to the policy
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Leave policy is automatically assigned to all employees in the selected employee structure. When new employees are added to the structure, they are automatically included in the policy.
rules_and_constraints: Automatic employee assignment in leave policies requires a pre-existing employee structure
The 'Manage employee assignment' button is disabled if no employee structure exists
Only employee structures can enable automatic assignment; manual selection is the alternative
Employees must be members of the selected structure to be included in the policy
edge_cases: If no employee structure is created, the automatic assignment button will be disabled with a tooltip message
Verify that the correct employee structure is selected to avoid assigning the policy to unintended employees
Monitor structure membership changes to ensure leave policy assignments remain accurate

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Lack of Granular Employee Directory Access Controls
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The HR employee directory does not provide granular access restriction functionality to limit which employees can view other users' profiles and information. While Payroll and Work Expenses modules have partial employee grouping capabilities, the core HR directory lacks comprehensive visibility controls, potentially exposing sensitive employee data to unauthorized viewers.
